name: Dewing 1308
commentary: Evidently a brocage of the issue of 1301-7, although the reverse die is not the same as the obverse die.  The explanation would seem to be that more than one obverse die was seated in the anvil, and that a coin struck from one lion in the anvil adhered to the punch die and struck a second flan which had been placed on a different lion.  The obverse die appears to be that used for McClean 4063, whose reverse has two pellets, A and an uncertain symbol.

reverse_type: Forepart of lion, profile to the left, head reverted (incuse)

name: Dewing 1951
commentary: The attribution of this issue to Andros is conjectural.  It is given to Athens by Seltman, Athens, its History and Coinage (Cambridge, 1924), p. 151-52 and Cahn, "Zur frhattischen Munzprgung," Museum Helveticum 3 (1946), p. 81, while in BMCCrete, p. 90, 14, and in Traite 2, 1, no. 1870, it is attributed to Carthaea on Ceos.  Hoard evidence, such as the 1889 Hoard (IGCH 6) and the Santorini Hoard (IGCH 7) in which this issue appeared with staters of Aegina and several Cycladic islands, would indicate that the mint is to be located on one of the Cycladic islands.  See also H. Bloesch, in S. Hurster and E. Paszthory, "Sptarchaischer Silberfund aus dem Antilibanon," eds., Essays Mildenberg (Wetteren, 1984), pp. 124-25.

name: Dewing 2350
commentary: Sometimes attributed to Miletus: see BMCIonia, p. 184, 6-11. Our coins quite possibly derive from one or both of the Santorini 1821 and Melos 1825 hoards (IGCH 7 and 8).

reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

name: Dewing 2353
commentary: A tentative attribution to the dynast Pigres at Syangela has been proposed by G.E. Bean and J.M. Cook, "The Carian Coast, III" ABSA 52 (1957), pp. 95-146.  The reverse pattern is discussed on O. Mrkholm and J. Zahle, "The Coinage of Kuprlli," ActaA 43 (1972), pp. 77-78.  For other coins recently attributed to Syangela see U. Yarkin, "The Coinage of Syangela in Caria," NC 1975, pp. 12-18, and "More Coins of Syangela in Caria," NC 1977, pp. 152-153.
obverse_type: Griffin's head, profile to the left
reverse_type: Stellate pattern in square latticed frame with inverted sides; all set diagonally in incuse square

name: Dewing 2355

reverse_type: Incuse square divided by central band; in field, letters (?)

name: Dewing 2357

reverse_type: Rough triangular shape in incuse square

name: Dewing 2360

name: Dewing 2384
commentary: The traditional attribution of the following coin to Poseidium on Karpathos has been thrown into considerable doubt by H.A. Cahn, "Poseidion on Karpathos?," NC 1957, pp. 11-12.  Cahn has no alternative location to suggest for the mint, but says it must be on the coast, or on the islands, between Rhodes and Samos.

reverse_type: Incuse square divided by striped band

name: Dewing 2385
commentary: Based on G.F. Hill, "Some Coins of Southern Asia Minor," Anatolian Studies Presented to Sir William Ramsay (Manchester, 1923), pp. 207-9.  Hill sees certain early Herakles heads in the series as portraits of Mausollos, comparing them to the Mausoleum statue in the British Museum and suggests that Artemisia is to be seen in the Demeter heads as on 2387.  Although the statue is by no means accepted today as that of Mausollos himself, Hill's coin arrangement is in many ways more satisfactory than the traditional one.
obverse_type: Bearded head of Herakles, profile to the right (with features of Mausollos?)
reverse_type: Crab; below, club

name: Dewing 2387
obverse_type: Bearded head of Herakles, profile to the right (with features of Mausollos?)
reverse_type: Veiled head of Demeter, profile to the left (with features of Artemisia?)

name: Dewing 2423
date_description: L. Weidauer argues for an earlier date, specifically one in the period 737/6-726 BC.
commentary: On the closing date of the important Foundation Deposit at the Ephesian Artemision (IGCH 1153) depends the dating of 2420-25, whose issues were all represented in the deposit.  As yet, however, there is no consensus on its burial date.

reverse_type: Two incuse squares, one slightly larger than the other

name: Dewing 2436

The dates given are based on Morkholm, but reflect also the evidence of the Podalia, or Bucak, 1957 Hoard (IGCH 1262: N. Olcay and O. Mrkholm, "The Coin Hoard from Podalia," NC 1971, pp. 1-29) and the Asyut 1969 Hoard (Asyut, pp. 99-102).

name: Dewing 2527
commentary: The obverse type has been obliterated, perhaps by the inadvertent blow of a hammer, or of a reverse die with square incuse, directly on the obverse side.  The obverse description here is from comparison to other coins struck from our reverse die...illustrated in BMCCyprus, pl. 22, 2 (discussed on pp. lxxii-lxxiii)....

name: Dewing 2529
commentary: The presence of the sprays on the reverse appears to rule out Nicodamus as the issuer, but the coin corresponds in all its details with none of the issues listed for Euelthon and his immediate successors in BMCCyprus, pp.lxxxv-lxxxviii.

reverse_type: Ankh with ring formed of dots; no inscription visible within ring; possible trace of unknown marking to right; all in incuse square with three-leaved sprays in each corner

commentary: See E. Boehringer, ZfN 1935, pl. 13, 7 (rev. only).  A. Salinas, Le monete delle antiche citta di Sicilia (1867) pl. 8, 6.  Selyman 8a (this coin).
obverse_type: Quadriga driven to the left by Akragas or Helios (?); below, crab; above, eagle of Zeus carrying snake; linear border; die scratches visible to upper left
reverse_type: Two eagles standing to the right on a hare; in right field, grasshopper

name: Dewing 567
obverse_type: Eagle with open wings standing profile to the right on hare. Border of dots.
reverse_type: Crab; below, sea serpent devouring mullet

name: Dewing 571

reverse_type: Crab

name: Dewing 572

reverse_type: Crab holding snake in left claw, below, octopus and murex; around, six pellets (only five pellets visible)

name: Dewing 582

reverse_type: Laureate head of Apollo, profile to the right

reverse_type: Quadriga, driven profile to the left by an auriga (charioteer); above, Nike flying toward him, holding wreath and kerykeion; in exergue, fish

name: Dewing 589

reverse_type: Kithara; in left and right field, six pellets

name: Dewing 599

reverse_type: Forepart of river god (Acheloos?) as man headed bull.

name: Dewing 613

reverse_type: Nymph Himera standing to the left pouring a libation on an altar from a phiale in her right hand; in left field, an altar; in right field, a small satyr standing in a basin, bending backward to receive water from fountain spout in the shape of a lion's head; in left field, a grain ear

name: Dewing 619

reverse_type: Lion's head; around, four barleycorns

name: Dewing 623

reverse_type: Laureate head of Apollo in Severe style; around, three laurel leaves; beneath, lion running profile to the right

name: Dewing 624
obverse_type: Laureate head of Apollo, profile to the right. Border of dots
reverse_type: Lion's head profile to the right; around, four barleycorns

name: Dewing 643

name: Dewing 649
obverse_type: Biga of mules driven by standing female charioteer (the nymph Messana); in exergue, two dolphins. Border of dots
reverse_type: Hare running to the right; below, dolphin. Border of dots.

reverse_type: Squatting Silenos holding kantharos and thyrsos; in left field, a stem of ivy.

name: Dewing 670
obverse_type: Hound standing profile to the right; border of dots.

name: Dewing 673

reverse_type: Head of the goddess Aegesta (Segesta), profile to the right

name: Dewing 678

reverse_type: Incuse square of "Union Jack" pattern.

name: Dewing 679

reverse_type: River god Hypsas, holding laurel branch and phiale, pouring libation on altar; around the altar, a snake twines; in right field, selinon leaf (celery) and heron, at right

name: Dewing 686
obverse_type: Quadriga driven to the right by charioteer; in exergue, thick line. Border of dots
reverse_type: Small female head, profile to the left, within an incuse square of "mill sail" design

name: Dewing 710
obverse_type: Quadriga driven to the right by a charioteer; above, Nike crowning horses. Border of dots.
reverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right; around, four dolphins

name: Dewing 780
commentary: Boehringer V192/R264 (New die combinations; as BMFA 356 and SNGANS 5).

reverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right; around, four dolphins. Very thin linear border.

name: Dewing 783

reverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right (copied from Damareteion); around, four dolphins

name: Dewing 847

reverse_type: Quadriga moving to the left; Nike flying to the right, to crown a charioteer; in exergue, an ear of barley at left. Linear border.

name: Dewing 877

reverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the left; around, four dolphins. Border of fine dots.

name: Dewing 89

reverse_type: Man-faced bull, profile to the left

name: Dewing 926

obverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the left; in right field, a star of eight rays. Border of dots.
reverse_type: Herakles, kneeling profile to the right, strangling the Nemean lion.

name: Dewing 929

reverse_type: Pegasos flying profile to the right

name: Dewing 930
obverse_type: Pegasus flying to the left
reverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Corinthian helmet with leather flap

name: BCMA 1914.6.16
date_description: Le Rider's group 1, but this should postdate the examples of the Asyut and decadrachm hoard. Perhaps not before ca. 470 BC.

reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

name: BCMA 1914.6.2
obverse_type: Satyr running to the right, carrying off nymph
reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

name: BCMA 1914.6.3
obverse_type: Satyr running to the right, carrying off nymph who gestures with both hands
reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

name: BCMA 1914.6.6

reverse_type: Owl, profile to the right; in left field, an olive sprig.

name: BCMA 1914.6.7

reverse_type: Helmeted Athena seated on throne to the left, her left arm resting on shield; winged Nike stands on Athena's right hand, and crowns Lysimachos' name.

name: BCMA 1914.6.8

reverse_type: Wreathed female head, perhaps of Aphrodite, profile to the right

name: BCMA 1915.94
date_description: Following downdating necessitated by Asyut and the 'decadrachm' hoard, nearer 460 than early fifth century. See Price and Waggoner 1975, 40-42 and Price 1986, 46.
obverse_type: Lion, profile to the right, attacking a bull, profile to the left; above, rosette or theta; in exergue, set off by row of dots, floral pattern (acanthus) or boukranion?; border of dots.
reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square.

name: BCMA 1915.98
date_description: Second half of fourth century or later.
obverse_type: Head of Athena facing to the left, wearing Corinthian helmet.
reverse_type: Herakles stands facing forward, Nemean lion skin over his left arm, club in right; he is crowned by flying Nike.

name: BCMA 1919.58.1
obverse_type: Head of Persephone, profile to the left; around, dolphins.
reverse_legend: In exergue, <foreign lang = "Greek">*S*U*R*A*K*O*S*I*W*N</foreign> and monogram <foreign lang = "Greek">*A*I</foreign>.
reverse_type: Quadriga galloping to the left, while the driver applies whip; above, triskeles.

name: BCMA 1919.58.104
date_description: The reversion to the former reverse type of lion attacking stag is probably to be dated to the end of the fourth century or third century.
obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the left, in Attic helmet with Pegasus. Behind her neck, <foreign lang = "Greek">*I*E</foreign> in square.
reverse_type: Lion attacking stag, profile to the left

name: BCMA 1919.58.12
date_description: Mid fifth century, or first three quarters of fourth century?
obverse_type: Boeotian shield.
reverse_type: Protome of horse galloping to the right

name: BCMA 1919.58.17
date_description: *F*I's name is given more fully elsewhere as Philistios. He seems to have been active in the late fourth and early third century.
obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet with griffin.
reverse_type: Lion walking to the right; above: <foreign lang = "Greek">*F*I</foreign> and pentagram.

name: BCMA 1919.58.18
obverse_type: Pegasus flying to the left
reverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the left, wearing Corinthian helmet; in field to the right, an anchor

name: BCMA 1919.58.19
obverse_type: Female head facing profile to the right
reverse_type: Ear of barley. In field, a plow (?).

name: BCMA 1919.58.2
obverse_type: Veiled head of Philistis (wife of Hieron 2), profile to the left
reverse_type: Quadriga galloping to the right, driven by winged Nike.

name: BCMA 1919.58.21
obverse_type: Herakles wielding club wrestles Cretan bull.
reverse_type: Hypsas holds laurel branch in his left hand, and pours a libation on an altar with his right hand; in right field, leaf of selinon (celery) and heron.

name: BCMA 1919.58.22
obverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right; around, four dolphins.
reverse_type: Quadriga walking to the right; above, Nike, flying profile to the right, crowns horses; in exergue, ketos, profile to the right; border of dots.

name: BCMA 1919.58.24
obverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right; around, four dolphins.
reverse_type: Quadriga walking to the right; above, Nike, flying to the right, crowns horses; in exergue, ketos profile to the right

name: BCMA 1919.58.25
obverse_type: Naked boy rider crowning horse advancing to the left
reverse_type: Dolphin rider holding trident, profile to the left, crowned by flying Nike; to right, a grape cluster

name: BCMA 1919.58.26
date_description: Early obverse and reverse types of Athenian foundation: ca. 440 BC.
obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet crowned with olive wreath.
reverse_type: Bull walking to the left

name: BCMA 1919.58.27
obverse_legend: Above horse, <foreign lang = "Greek">*I*O</foreign>, between legs in two lines <foreign lang = "Greek">*N*E*U *M*H</foreign>
obverse_type: Horseman advancing profile to the right, crowning horse.
reverse_legend: Below, <foreign lang = "Greek">*T*A*R*A*S</foreign>. Above to r, <foreign lang = "Greek">*P*O*L*Y</foreign>
reverse_type: Dolphin rider facing to the left, holding a helmet; in left and right field, starbursts.

name: BCMA 1919.58.28
date_description: Wreathed Athena and walking bull are early types: ca. 440-430 BC?
obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet crowned with olive wreath.
reverse_type: Bull walking to the right; in exergue, fish.

name: BCMA 1919.58.29
obverse_type: Ear of barley.
reverse_type: Incuse ear of barley.

name: BCMA 1919.58.3
obverse_type: Head of nymph, profile to the right
reverse_type: Winged Nike seated, profile to the left, with bird perched on raised right hand.

name: BCMA 1919.58.31
obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet with Scylla.
reverse_type: Bull charging to the right; in exergue, fish. Above bull, abbreviated name.

name: BCMA 1919.58.37
obverse_type: Head of Alexander the Great, profile to the right, diademed and with horns of Ammon; border of dots.
reverse_type: Athena seated on throne to the left, her left arm resting on shield; winged Nike stands to the left on Athena's outstretched right hand, and crowns Lysimachos' name.

name: BCMA 1919.58.39a
date_description: Le Rider group 8 (see Le Rider 1977, 189-191 with plate 4), dated ca. 180 to early first century. On style, this example probably belongs relatively early in the series.
obverse_type: Head of beardless Dionysos, profile to the right, wearing ivy wreath.
reverse_type: Herakles standing facing, looking to the right; with his right hand, he leans on the club, with the Nemean lion skin draped over his left arm, and his bow slung over his left shoulder. Between club and his right leg, a monogram.

name: BCMA 1919.58.4
obverse_type: Squatting satyr. In field to to the left, a pellet.
reverse_type: Shallow incuse square divided into four equal parts.

name: BCMA 1919.58.40
obverse_type: Satyr running to the right, carrying off nymph who gestures with both hands
reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

name: BCMA 1919.58.4a
date_description: Reign of Alexander the Great (336-323 BC) or later.
obverse_type: Beardless head of Herakles in Nemean lion skin, profile to the right; border of dots.
reverse_type: Zeus seated to the left on a throne; in left hand, a scepter; seated on his extended right hand, an eagle; border of dots. Mint of Babylon.

name: BCMA 1919.58.58
obverse_type: Tripod.
reverse_type: Incuse tripod.

name: BCMA 1919.58.5a
date_description: ca. 342/1-329/8 BC according to Le Rider 1977 (group 2 B of Amphipolis). Le Rider's chronology is rejected by Price 1979 and Martin 1985 Appendix 4.

reverse_type: Horseman carrying palm rides profile to the right; below horse's front legs, janiform head

name: BCMA 1919.58.63
obverse_type: Amphora; sprouting from top, vines.
reverse_type: Starburst consisting of eight large rays alternating with eight small rays; in center, six dots around a central dot; border of dots.

name: BCMA 1919.58.64
date_description: ca. 480 BC? This obol appears to belong to Williams' Period 1 (which he dates ca. 510-478: see Williams 1972), and may have been part of the increased production of coinage at Phocis at the time of the Persian invasion.
obverse_type: Bull protome, profile to the right
reverse_type: Boar protome, profile to the right, within incuse square.

name: BCMA 1919.58.65
date_description: Early in the period 234/3-168 BC (duration of the Koinon of Epirus). See Franke 1961, 139-140 for the argument and hoard evidence that the official KE(phalos) was active early in the lifetime of the Koinon, with catalog entries 166-168.
commentary: See <bibl>Franke 1961</bibl>-- there are 16 examples of this obverse/reverse combination with the monogram of the official KE.  This is the most common obverse/reverse pair for drachms of the Epirote republic.
obverse_type: Wreathed head of Zeus, profile to the right; behind head, ligature of <foreign lang = "Greek">*K*E</foreign>; border of dots.
reverse_type: Eagle with closed wings perched to the right on thunderbolt; around, oak wreath.

name: BCMA 1919.58.66
date_description: Mid fifth century, or first three quarters of fourth century?
obverse_type: Boeotian shield
reverse_type: Protome of horse galloping to the right

name: BCMA 1919.58.67
obverse_type: Tripod; to the left, a heron.
reverse_type: Incuse tripod.

name: BCMA 1919.58.68
date_description: *F*I's name is given more fully elsewhere as Philistios. He seems to have been active in the late fourth and early third century.
obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet with griffin.
reverse_type: Lion walking to the right; above, dolphin and retrograde <foreign lang = "Greek">*F*I</foreign>.

name: BCMA 1919.58.73
date_description: Second half of fourth century or later.

name: BCMA 1919.58.8 D

name: BCMA 1919.58.89

reverse_type: Owl, profile to the right; in left field, olive sprig and crescent.

name: BCMA 1919.58.97

reverse_type: Horseman galloping profile to the right; below, club of Herakles.

A bare male head, profile to the right. Triskeles symbol in left field.

Traditionally this head has been taken to represent the Consul, M. Claudius Marcellus. But Lahusen has now argued that the person represented is Cn. Cornelius Lentulus Marcellinus, consul in 56 B.C.

obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Caracalla, bearded and wearing a radiate crown, facing right
reverse_type: Within a circle rides Caracalla, on horseback, profile to the right. He carries a spear diagonally in his right hand.

name: Boston 1975.358
sources_used: <hi rend="ital">Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum, Deutschland, Sammlung von Aulock</hi>, vol. 4, no. 1277
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right. He wears the aegis and holds a spear over his left shoulder.
reverse_type: Within a circle stands the emperor, in military costume, between two military standards. He stands in a frontal pose, with his head to the left, holding a spear in his left hand and, in his right, a patera above a low altar.

name: Boston 58.695
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left. He wears the aegis.
reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*K*O*I*N*O*N *Q*R*A*K*W*N *A*L*E*C*A*N*D*R*I*A *E*N *F*I*L*I</Foreign> (around); <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*P*O*P*O</Foreign> (in exergue);  <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*Y*Q*I*A</Foreign> (across field, left and right)
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the nude figure of Hercules, slightly to the left. He holds his club in his right hand and his lion skin in his left.

name: Boston 1971.136
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
comparanda: Thodore Mionnet, <hi rend="ital">Description de mdailles antiques, greques et romaines</hi> III (Paris 1818-1837) 46, no. 101, var. rev. legend
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Zeus Boulaios, bearded, facing left. Drapery appears on his left shoulder.
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle an assembly of city gods of Pergamon, Mytilene, and Ephesos. At left stands Asklepios of Pergamon, draped and bearded, with a snake around the staff in his right hand. At center sits the Tyche of Mytilene, facing. She wears a mural crown, holds a phiale in her right hand, a rudder in her left hand, and a cornucopia on her left arm.  At right stands the facing multi-breasted statue of Artemis of Ephesos, with two scepters.

name: Boston 64.1451
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Elagabalus, cuirassed, facing right. He wears a cloak around his shoulders and the gorgoneion on his breastplate.
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the emperor, in military costume, clasping hands with the figure of Apollo Tyrimnaios, nude except for a cloak that falls from his shoulders. Both stand in frontal poses, with their heads turned towards an agonistic urn at center that the emperor holds over a flaming altar. Apollo holds a double ax in his left hand.

name: Boston 1971.45
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, cuirassed and draped, facing right
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a bird's-eye view of the forum at Laodiceia. Within stands the emperor, standing profile to the right on a podium, delivering a speech.  Citizens appear around him, on each side and between columns in front.

name: Boston 58.13
sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Mysia, 156, no. 326, pl. 31, 6; L. Forrer, <hi rend="ital">Weber Collection of Greek Coins</hi> III (London 1924) pl. 190, 5227
donor: In memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, cuirassed and draped, facing right. He wears the gorgoneion on his breastplate.
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands Caracalla, in military dress, in 3/4-view to the left, saluting the Asklepian serpent, coiled around a tree. Between the two is a facing statue of Telesphoros, on a tall cylindrical base.

name: Boston 1984.218
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, cuirassed and draped, facing left. He wears the aegis.
reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*K*O*I*N*O*N *Q*R*A*K*W*N *A*L*E*C*A*N*D*R*I*A *E*N *F*I*L*I</Foreign> (around); <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*O*P*O</Foreign> (in exergue); <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*U*Q*I*A</Foreign> (across field, left and right)
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the nude figure of a discus thrower, in 3/4-view to the left. He holds a discus in his left hand and three balls in his outstretched right hand.

name: Boston 1982.467
sources_used: See F. Imhoof-Blmer, <hi rend="ital">Lydische Stadtmnzen</hi> (Bologna 1978) 159, 30, for rev. (Severus Alexander)
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate busts of Elagabalus and Severus Alexander, draped and cuirassed, facing each other. Elagabalus wears a laurel wreath.
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, stands the nude figure of Helios (Sun), in a facing quadriga, with the horses shown in profile to right and left. Helios, wearing a radiate crown, holds a laurel branch in his lowered right hand and a double ax in his left.

name: Boston 1982.283
sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> III, no. 89, pl. 33.2; head right; <hi rend="ital">Collection R. Jameson</hi> III (Paris 1913-1924) 165, no. 442
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
commentary: This piece is a mirror comprised of two Imperial bronze coins
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bare bust of Antinous, facing left
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, Antinous dressed as a herdsman, advancing in 3/4-view to the left, toward a reed; a star in the upper left field.

name: Boston 58.702
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: IMP CAESAR HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P (around)
obverse_type: Within a circle, the laureate bust of Hadrian, bearded, facing right
reverse_type: Hadrian and a companion in military dress, on horseback, gallop in profile to the right.  Each mounted figure holds a spear horizontally. At right walks a soldier, in 3/4-view to the right, carrying a shield.

name: Boston 65.59
sources_used: M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 28-29, fig. 1; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.6, no. 29, pl. 39, no. 8 (bronze)</bibl>
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: The laureate bust of Hadrian, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
reverse_type: The half-draped Genius of the Roman people stands in 3/4-view to the left, holding a cornucopia on his left arm, and a patera in his right hand, over a flaming, garlanded altar

name: Boston 1984.581
sources_used: Paul Strack, <hi rend="ital">Untersuchungen zur rmischen reichsprgung des zweiter jahrhunderts</hi> (Stuttgart 1931-37) 2.129, no. 450
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Hadrian, bearded, facing left
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the emperor, wearing a hunter's cloak, rides to the right on a rearing horse. With a spear in his upraised right hand, he aims to kill a lion, running in profile to the right.

name: Boston 1984.217
sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.17, under no. 70 (this as Weber Collection of Greek Coins)</bibl>
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: ANTONINVS AVG PIVS P P TR P XIX COS IIII (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Antoninus Pius, bearded, facing right
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the helmeted and cloaked figure of Mars, in 3/4-view to the right. He turns his head back to the left, as he reaches his right hand out to place a helmet on a trophy, at left. In his left hand Mars holds a spear and a shield.

name: Boston 58.964
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: M ANTONINVS AVG TR P XXIX (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Marcus Aurelius, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the facing figure of Apollo, on a high-backed throne, holding a lyre in his left hand and a plectrum in his right. His bow and arrow rest against the left side of the throne.

name: Boston 59.185
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Lucilla, facing right
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the nude figure of Cupid and the draped figure of Venus. Cupid, at left, stands in 3/4-view to the right, with his right hand raised. Venus stands slightly to the right, but looks back to the left, where she reaches toward Cupid, with her right hand. She also holds a scepter in her left hand. At right is a lighted altar.

name: Boston 37.1162
donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: M COMMODVS ANTONINVS PIVS FELIX AVG BRIT (around)
obverse_type: The laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
reverse_type: Commodus, in military garb, stands in 3/4-view to the right, toward the draped figure of Africa (the personification of the province), who reclines to the left. He holds a parazonium and a reversed spear on an elephant-scalp helmet. Africa, caressing a lion with her right hand, holds two ears of wheat in her left hand. Between them stands winged, draped Victoria (Victory), in profile to the right, placing a shield on a trophy.

name: Boston 58.966
donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: The laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, draped, and wearing a cuirass with scales, facing right
reverse_legend: [P M TR P VIIII IMP VI COS] IIII P P (around); TEMPORVM FELICITAS (in exergue)
reverse_type: Pomona (the personification of Fruit) seated in profile to the right, on a backed chair, holding corn ears and a poppy in her left hand. She raises her right hand to a grape vine, below which frolic two children in a tub, and a third at the feet of the goddess.

name: Boston 65.907
sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.71, no. 174</bibl>; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3.356-57, no. 993</bibl>; M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 30-31, fig. 3
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: M COMMODVS ANTONINVS PIVS FELIX AVG BRIT (around)
obverse_type: The laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left
reverse_type: The harbor at Ostia. In front of the lighthouse, at right, stands the emperor with another standing figure, facing a sacrificed bull in the foreground.  At left is a large ship, under sail, with Serapis seated in the stern.  Two smaller ships, one with standards, float in the center, while two more ships, one under sail, appear above.

name: Boston 66.882
sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.64, no. 116</bibl>; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3.379, no. 2, where obverse is termed Marcia</bibl>; M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 31-32, fig. 5
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: L AELIVS AVRELIVS COMMODVS AVG PIVS FELIX (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bust of Commodus, wearing a radiate crown and bearded, overlaps that of Roma, helmeted and wearing a necklace. Both face right. A pelta (Amazonian shield) appears in the lower right field.
reverse_legend: P M TR P XVII IMP VIII COS VII P P (around)
reverse_type: The nude figure of Hercules, with his lion skin over his left arm, and his right hand on his hip, stands in 3/4-view to the right, toward the togate and veiled emperor, Commodus. Commodus sacrifices, presumably to Hercules, over a lighted cylindrical altar, in the center.

name: Boston 68.17
sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.73, no. 2</bibl>; <bibl>Toynbee 1944, 104</bibl>; M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 33-34, fig. 6; W. M. Whitehall, <hi rend="ital">MFA Boston. A Centennial History</hi> (Cambridge 1970) 667; <bibl>Greek & Roman Portraits 1972, no. 66</bibl>
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Clodius Albinus, bearded, facing right
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the draped figure of Fortuna (Fortune), in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a rudder in her left hand and a cornucopia in her left arm. A wheel sits on the left side of her throne.

name: Boston 35.1465
sources_used: <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3, Lucius Verus, 204, no. 345, 346</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.48, no. 30, pl. 75, no. 3</bibl>, but the SC in the exergue is unique, indicating a Senatorial Medallion
donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: L AVREL VERVS AVG ARMENIACVS IMP II TR P V COS II (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Lucius Verus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the winged and draped figure of Victoria (Victory) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a palm in her right hand but turns her head back to the right, where she reaches her left hand out to a trophy that she has erected. A diminutive Armenian stands in 3/4-view to the left, next to the trophy, with his hands clasped in front. A second Armenian is seated on the ground, at the foot of the trophy, profile to the right, clasping his left knee.

name: Boston 64.695
sources_used: <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3, Lucius Verus, no. 308</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.47, no. 20, pl. 746</bibl> (cf. <bibl>Grueber 1874, pl. 25.3</bibl>); M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 29-31, fig. 2
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: L VERVS AVG ARM PARTH MAX (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Lucius Verus, facing left. He wears a scaled cuirassed and a paludamentum appears on his right shoulder.
reverse_legend: TR P VIII IMP IIII COS III (around)
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the facing figure of Jupiter (Conservator). He holds a thunderbolt in his right hand and a scepter in his left. He is bearded and nude, except for a mantle which he holds over the (diminutive) togate figures of Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus, who stand at his feet, each in 3/4-view to the left.

name: Boston 1973.550
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
commentary: Imperial bronze medallion; the rim is turned up slightly, which suggests that it might have been formerly framed.
obverse_legend: ANTONINVS AVG PIVS P P TR P COS IIII (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bearded bust of Antoninus Pius, facing right.
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the bearded, nude figure of Hercules, near profile to the right, in a rustic landscape. He holds his club in his lowered right hand and his bow in his left hand, and his lion skin is draped over his left arm. Behind him is a bare tree.  At right (in front of him) is a pile of rocks on which stands a hind who nurses the infant Telephus. An eagle is perched, to the left, on a rock behind the animal.

name: Boston 1970.589
sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.43, no. 2 (the three other known specimens), pl. 71, nos. 3, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">Coin World</hi>, May 5, 1971, 3 (ill.); <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 82, no. C28 (ill.)</bibl>
donor: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Cornelius C. Vermeule III
obverse_legend: [IMP ANTONINVS] AVG COS III IMP VERVS AVG COS II (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate busts of Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus, draped and cuirassed, facing each other
reverse_type: Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus, both in military costume, stand facing each other, clasping hands, on which they support a draped, winged figure of Victoria (Victory).  Below their hands is a prisoner, crouched in profile to the right. At left stand three soldiers and at right stand two more.

name: Boston 37.27
sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.64, no. 117, 118 (both 40 mm, 118 has radiate head of Commodus)</bibl>; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3.380, nos. 3-4</bibl>
obverse_legend: L AELIVS AVRELIVS COMMODVS AVG PIVS FELIX (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the jugate busts of Commodus and Roma or Minerva (or Marcia in the guise of one of these goddesses), facing right. Commodus is laureate, draped, and cuirassed.  Roma, helmeted, wears a cuirass with an aegis.
reverse_legend: P M TR P XVII IMP VIII COS VII P P (around)
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the draped figure of Pietas (Piety) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a scepter in her left hand and extends her right hand to a naked child, who stands in profile to the right, before her.

name: Boston 60.5
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Hadrian, facing left
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the half-draped figure of the genius of the Roman people, in 3/4-view to the left. He holds a cornucopia in his left hand and, in his right hand, a patera over a lighted and garlanded altar.

name: Boston 68.150
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within at least three concentric dotted circles, the draped bust of Lucilla, facing right. Her hair is waved and braided and tied in a bun at the nape of her neck.
reverse_legend: PIETAS (around); S C (across field, left and right)
reverse_type: Pietas standing, head right, holding patera and box.  At left, flaming altar.

name: Boston 1993.66
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: FL IVL CONSTANS P F AVG (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the diademed bust of Constans I, draped and cuirassed, facing right
reverse_legend: GAVDIVM POPVLI ROMANI (around); VOT / V / MVLT / X (within wreath); A Q (in exergue)
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a laurel wreath circumscribing an inscription, in four lines

name: Boston 1980.210
sources_used: Herbert Grueber, <hi rend="ital">Roman Medallions in the British Museum</hi> (London 1874) 51, no. 1
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a circle, the draped bust of Otacilia Severa, facing left. She wears a stephane (crown) over her waved hair, arranged in at least seven ridges, which terminates in a long braid brought up the back of her head.
reverse_type: Within a circle sits the draped figure of Otacilia as Pudicitia (Modesty) seated in 3/4-view to the left. She draws her veil over her face with her right hand and holds a scepter at a diagonal in her left hand.  In front of her are two children, standing in profile to the right, one of whom raises a hand to her.  Behind her stands the draped figure of Felicitas (Felicity), with her legs crossed, leaning on Pudacitia's throne. She holds a cornucopia in her left arm and a caduceus in her right hand.

name: Boston 34.1382
donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: IMP C M Q TRAIANVS DECIVS AVG (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Trajan Decius, wearing a radiate crown and a slight beard, facing right
reverse_legend: FELICITAS SAECVLI (around); S C (across field, left and right)
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Felicitas (Felicity) in 3/-view to the left. She holds a caduceus in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm.

name: Boston 1972.865
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a circle, the draped and cuirassed busts of Saloninus, at left, and  Gallienus, laureate, at right
reverse_type: Within a circle stand four figures in military dress, all facing toward the center. The central two figures are emperors, clasping hands on which they support a draped, winged figure of Victoria (Victory), standing on a globe and holding a wreath.  Behind each emperor stands a soldier holding a military standard.

name: Boston 1991.5
sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.115, no. 3</bibl>; pl. 118, no. 10; C.C. Vermeule and F.Z. Wolsky, <hi rend="ital">The Museum Year: 1990-91</hi> 26 (ill.)
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: IMP C M ANN FLORIANVS P AVG (around)
obverse_type: Within a circle, the laureate bust of Florianus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
reverse_type: Within a circle stand the draped figures of three Monetae (Mints), each holding a scale in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm, with a pile of metal at her feet

name: Boston 1974.531
sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.134, no. 3, pl. 130, no. 2</bibl>; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 158, no. C120 (ill.)</bibl>; C. Vermeule, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 73 (1975) 20 (ill.); <bibl>Knudsen 1988, 57, 83, 225, 291, fig. 22</bibl>
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the diademed bust of Constantine the Great, draped and cuirassed, facing right
reverse_legend: GLORIA SAECVLI VIRTVS CAESS (around); P R (in exergue)
reverse_type: Constantine II, in military costume, presents a phoenix on a globe to the half-draped emperor, Constantine the Great, seated in 3/4-view to the left, on a cuirass. Constantine II, standing to the right, holds a trophy over his left shoulder, while a panther is seated, to the right, at his feet. Constantine the Great holds a scepter in his left hand, while he receives the globe with her right.

name: Boston 60.151
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Magnentius, facing right
reverse_type: Within a circle runs the draped and winged figure of Victoria (Victory) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a wreath in her extended right hand and a palm in her left.

name: Boston 1972.1000
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
commentary: Imperial bronze medallion. The coin has been pierced in the middle and subsequently plugged. The reverse has been double struck.
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed half figure of Decentius, facing right. He holds a spear, at a diagonal, in his right hand, and a figure of Victoria (Victory), standing on a globe and presenting him a wreath, in his left hand.
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the emperor, dressed in military costume, rides on horseback in profile to the right. In his right hand he holds a spear which he has struck a falling barbarian.

name: Boston 1970.569
sources_used: <bibl>Toynbee 1944, 164, pl. 29.2 (this example, as private collection, Rome)</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2, pl. 100, no. 9 (same obverse die)</bibl>
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: The draped bust of Julia Mamaea, facing left. She wears a stephane (crown) over her wavy hair that is bound at the nape of her neck.
reverse_type: The veiled and crowned figure of Julia Mamaea, in the guise of Pudicitia (Modesty), is seated on a throne in 3/4-view to the right, between the draped personifications, Felicitas (Felicity), at left, and Pietas (Piety), at right. Felicitas holds a short scepter diagonally in her right hand and rests her left hand on her hip. Julia reaches her left hand up to her veil. Pietas, also veiled, reaches her right arm toward Julia and holds a cornucopia in her left arm.

name: Boston 34.1381
donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a circle, the draped bust of Etruscilla, facing right, rising from a crescent. She wears a stephane (crown) and her hair is gathered at the back in a long braid brought up the back of her  head
reverse_type: The veiled and draped figure of Pudicitia (Modesty), enthroned  in 3/4-view to the left, with her feet on a low footstool. She holds her veil away from her face with her right hand and holds a scepter, at a diagonal, in  her left hand.

name: Boston 1971.358
sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> V, 514, no. 101, variable spacing in reverse legend
donor: Gift of Miss Mary B. Comstock
obverse_legend: IMP CAES M OPEL SEV MACRINVS AVG (around)
obverse_type: Within a circle, the laureate bust of Macrinus, bearded and cuirassed, facing right
reverse_type: Within a circle stands the veiled and draped figure of Fides (Faith), in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a military standard upright in each hand.

name: Boston 59.516
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
commentary: Imperial silver medallion with traces of gilding
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Volusian, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
reverse_type: Within a circle stand the draped figures of three Monetae (Mints), each holding a scale in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm, with a pile of metal at her feet

name: Boston 35.694
sources_used: <bibl>Toynbee 1944, 149, n. 25, pl. XLVII, 5 and 6 (neither exact), pl. 47.5</bibl>; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 6.290, no. 376</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.118, no. 24, IX th. var., pl. 120, no. 5 (13 specimens)</bibl>
donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Probus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left. On his left shoulder is the emperor's shield, from behind which his spear seems to emerge, toward the left. The shield is decorated with a scene of the emperor on horseback, riding to the left, preceded by the winged Victoria (Victory) and followed by a soldier.
reverse_type: Within a circle stand the draped figures of three Monetae (Mints), each holding a scale in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm, with a pile of metal at her feet

name: Boston 58.697
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: FL IVL CONSTANS P F AVG (around)
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the diademed bust of Constans I, draped and cuirassed, facing right
reverse_legend: VICTORIAE D D N N AVGG (around); VOT / X / MVL / XX (on shield); SIS (in exergue)

name: Boston 64.2127
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P
obverse_type: Bust of Hadrian, facing right. He is bearded (as is usual), and draped.
reverse_type: Personification of Egypt seated, facing left. Egypt holds a sistrum in her right hand and rests her left arm on a basket of fruits.  At left stands an ibis on a column.

name: Boston 65.442
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P
obverse_type: Bust of laureate Hadrian, facing right.  He is draped and bearded.
reverse_legend: ADVENTVI AVG CI LICIAE; S C (in exergue)
reverse_type: Hadrian stands on the left holding a roll and facing a personification of Cilicia on the right.  Cilicia holds a patera (knobbed, sacrificial plate) above a lighted altar in her right hand and a vexillum in her left hand.

name: Boston 65.444
sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> III, 494, no. 1664; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 2.111.63, without obverse drapery</bibl>
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P
obverse_type: Draped bust of Hadrian, facing right. He is bearded (as is usual).
reverse_legend: ADVENTVI AVG MAV RETANIAE; S C (in exergue)
reverse_type: Hadrian stands on the left with a roll in his left hand facing the personification of Mauretania who is standing at the right with a vexillum in her left hand and a patera (knobbed, sacrificial plate) in right.  A lighted altar stands between them and a bull stands behind.

name: Boston 65.445
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Bust of laureate Hadrian, facing right.  He is bearded (as is usual) and draped on his left shoulder.
reverse_type: Neptune stands facing to the right with his right foot on a prow (?).  He is holding a trident in his right hand and an acrostolium in his left.

name: Boston 65.448
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P
obverse_type: Draped bust of Hadrian, facing left.  He is bearded (as is usual).
reverse_type: Hadrian in military dress on horseback facing right.  He is looking at three soldiers holding a legionary eagle and standards.

name: Boston 65.449
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P
obverse_type: Laureate bust of Hadrian, facing right.  He is draped and bearded (as is usual).
reverse_type: The personification of the Nile reclines, looking to the right. He holds in his left hand a cornucopia, and is flanked on each side by an infant. At the right, a hippopotamus stands facing left.  Reeds stand behind him  and a crocodile below.

name: Boston 68.708
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P
obverse_type: Draped bust of Hadrian, facing right.  He is bearded (as is usual).
reverse_type: The personification of Alexandria reclines facing left, her left arm rests on a basket of grain.  She is holding ears of grain and a poppy in her right hand and a vine branch in her left.  Grain is growing on the left.

name: Boston 1970.66
sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> III, 431, no. 1294 ff., for general type, all vary
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Bust of Hadrian, facing right. He is draped on his left shoulder and bearded.
reverse_legend: CO S III; S C (in exergue)
reverse_type: Helmeted Roma seated, facing to the left on a cuirass, holding a cornucopia in her left hand, and Victory with a wreath on her right hand.  At her side are a shield and quiver (?).  A helmet and greave by her feet.

name: Boston 1972.77
sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> III, 519, no. 1797, variable; note 1797 (this specimen = Trau, no. 1280); for dating see cxliv
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a laureate bust of Hadrian, facing left.  He is draped, cuirassed, and bearded.
reverse_legend: RESTITV TORI ARABIAE; S C (in exergue)
reverse_type: Togate Hadrian stands on the left.  He extends his right hand to help up a kneeling personification of Arabia.  A camel stands between them.

name: Boston 1982.601
donor: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Cornelius C. Vermeule III in the name of Cornelius Adrian Comstock Vermeule
obverse_type: Laureate bust of Hadrian, facing right.  He is draped, cuirassed, and bearded (as is usual).
reverse_legend: P M TR P COS III; S C (across field)
reverse_type: Ceres, standing in a 3/4 frontal view facing left, holds a long torch in her left hand, and ears of grain in her right.

name: Boston 1982.602
donor: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Cornelius C. Vermeule III in the name of Cornelius Adrian Comstock Vermeule
obverse_legend: IMP CAESAR TRAIANVS HADRIA NVS AVG P M TR P COS III
obverse_type: Laureate bust of Hadrian, facing right.  His bust is cut to make him appear as if he were draped.
reverse_legend: VICTOR IA AVGVSTI; S C (across field)
reverse_type: Winged Victory stands looking  to the right.  She holds a trophy in her right hand.

name: Boston 1985.234
sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> III, 453, no. 1400, note and clxx for date; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 2.668 with Triton</bibl>
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_legend: HADRIANVS AVGVSTVS (last two A's written without crossbars)
obverse_type: Laureate bust of Hadrian, facing right.  He is draped and bearded.
reverse_legend: FELICITATI AVG (above, first A written without crossbars); COS III P P (in exergue); S C (across field)
reverse_type: Galley with six rowers and a steersman.  Triton stands on the prow blowing his horn and  a legionary eagle and standard are in the stern.

name: Boston 1986.890
donor: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Cornelius C. Vermeule III in the name of Cornelius Adrian Comstock Vermeule
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, bust of laureate Hadrian, facing right.  He is draped, cuirassed, and bearded.
reverse_legend: PM TR P CO S III; VIR T AVG / S C (across field)
reverse_type: Virtus stands facing front, with her right foot on a helmet.  She is holding a spear in her right hand, and a parazonium on her left arm.

name: Boston 35.690
donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, bust of Sabina, facing right. She is draped and wears her hair in a plait down her neck.  She wears a tiara.
reverse_type: Venus standing with her head turned to the right.  She is holding her garment in her right hand and an apple in her left.

name: Boston 1982.603
sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> III, 536, no. 1867 (with wreath on corn ears; see clxxxiv for date)
donor: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Cornelius C. Vermeule III in the name of Cornelius Adrian Comstock Vermeule
obverse_legend: SABINA AVGVSTA HADRIANI AVG P P
obverse_type: Bust of Sabina, facing right. She is draped and wears her hair in a plait down her neck.  She wears a tiara.
reverse_legend: CONCOR DIA AVG; S C (in exergue)
reverse_type: Concordia (goddess of harmony) enthroned faces left.  She holds a patera (knobbed, sacrificial plate) in her right hand, she rests her left arm on a statuette of Spes (hope).

name: Boston 67.630
donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zo Wilbour
obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bare bust of L. Aelius, bearded, facing right
reverse_legend: TR POT COS II (around); S C (across field, left and right)
reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the figure of Spes (the personification of Hope), walking to the left, holding a flower in her right hand and her skirt in her left
